node.bodyText: Problem was with the firebase packages, but after updating firebase packages everything seems to be good now.

node.title: Support for smart invert on iOS has regressed

node.bodyText:
flutter/engine#6176
#21457
Its possible this is a recent change, or may not be related to an iOS version. On the iPhone 7 this still works as expected.
@jonahwilliams if you give repro steps and expected results we can ask the triagers to try on different versions and devices.

Steps:

go to the iOS settings and search for "Smart Invert" (not classic invert) and enable it.
flutter run the old gallery in flutter/dev/integration_tests/flutter_gallery
most colors should be inverted.
Navigate to studies, then "fortnightly"
The image header should not be inverted.

This works for me on iPhone 7. On the iPad pro after enabling smart invert the screen of the flutter app is not inverted at all

The app was inverted and the fortnightly image header was not inverted (so it still worked) on the physical devices I tried:




iOS
Working




iPhone 6s
13.7
✅


iPhone 12 Pro
15.4.1
✅


iPhone 14
16.2
✅


iPad Pro (11-inch) (3rd generation)
16.2
✅



All the simulator devices and iOS versions I tried did reproduce the issue and the app wasn't inverted, but the header image was.

node.title: [Impeller] Improve efficiency of apps with excessive overdraw.

node.bodyText: err not the shopping but Crane. Though it probably tracks for all of them
This happens with all of the routes actually.
This app is using the router/navigator the same way most other apps would, so it doesn't seem to be an app specific problem
Some sort of issue with modal routes? The route itself isn't really modal, it covers the entire screen, but perhaps it is implented with one and that is why the preivous route sticks around.

ahh potentially false alarm. We might still be able to do something here, but this is a but in the gallery. It thinkgs the iPad is a foldable device so it opens the sub-pass in a positioned widget instead of using a Route.
We might still use this as an opportunity to do better but its clearly a misuse of the Flutter API.

node.title: Improve the "bad architecture" `flutter` error
Large image crashes app on Safari mobile browser

node.bodyText:
@geronimol
Try using cacheWidth and cacheHeight. I think a good practice is to use these properties when you are using big size images.

@geronimol Try using cacheWidth and cacheHeight. I think a good practice is to use these properties when you are using big size images.

Tried this, but the problem persists.
I think there is something wrong with that image when I try to open it from github via my phone (chrome) it loads the image but when I scoll down the screen goes to white.

Hi @geronimol
I tested this with 3.5MB image but it's loaded well without crashing (iPhone 7, iOS 15.7.2).
Can you provide the source image along with device info (OS, model)? Also, can you follow this guideline and check if there is any error log from the Safari console?

node.title: The same code is displayed inconsistently on android, window and web

node.bodyText: Hello @dong-lufei. You need to add a Scaffold :). On web the default background is black, while on iOS and Android, the background is black. A Scaffold adds some default styling that is needed by a lot of widgets. Try wrapping your Center in a Scaffold and you should see consistency. Closing this issue as this is working as expected. Thank you

node.title: Bdazzle43

node.bodyText:
When opening an issue, please try to provide all or some of the information indicated in the template so that we can address this issue properly.

Issue Template
If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
- https://flutter.dev/
- https://api.flutter.dev/
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
to what you're looking for, then fill our the template below. Please read
our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports

Steps to Reproduce

Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into.

Please attach a small application (ideally just one main.dart file) that
reproduces the problem. You could use https://gist.github.com/ for this.

If the problem is with your application's rendering, then please attach
a screenshot and explain what the problem is.

1. ...
2. ...
3. ...


Please tell us which target platform(s) the problem occurs (Android / iOS / Web / macOS / Linux / Windows)
Which target OS version, for Web, browser, is the test system running?
Does the problem occur on emulator/simulator as well as on physical devices?

Target Platform:
Target OS version/browser:
Devices:

Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
to explain how to solve the issue.

Run `flutter analyze` and attach any output of that command below.
If there are any analysis errors, try resolving them before filing this issue.

Finally, paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here.


Closing this issue, since no information has been provided.

node.title: [webview_flutter] cannot use onWebViewCreated property on 4.0.2

node.bodyText: I don't think they are the same here. I am not sure why this was removed, or if using .then() on loadRequest is the intended alternative, or if there is a something similar to onWebViewCreated that I haven't found yet . I'll label this as a bug none the less, and allow some insights from the team on this.

Please see https://pub.dev/packages/webview_flutter#instantiating-webviewcontroller; the relationship between the controller and the widget has changed, so an asyncronous callback to get the controller no longer makes sense.
If you have a use case you can't implement with the new APIs, please file an issue describing the use case, not the old API.

node.title: `PopupMenuButton` wrapped with a local `ScrollbarTheme` doesn't update the scrollbar in the popup menu.
[Web] Uncaught Error: FormatException: SyntaxError: JSON.parse: expected property name or '}' at line 1 column 2 of the JSON data on Safari and Firefox web browsers

node.bodyText:
@binemmanuel
Can you please look at the "Network" tab in the browser devtools and confirm what kind of response the app gets from the server? This would explain the different error observed. If valid JSON is served but JSON.parse still produces an error, then it would be a bug in the JSON parser. Otherwise, it might be a misconfiguration of the server or something else.

@darshankawar  On the Network Tab on Safari and Firefox it doesn't even show that a request was made to the endpoint but on the Console Tap, there is an error which should only show up after a request to the endpoint.
I cleared cache on both browsers and it magically works fine.
Does that mean the error doesn't occur anymore ?
@darshankawar Yes, the error is completely gone.
@binemmanuel Based on your comment, closing the issue as solved. Thanks!

node.title: Dropdown widget overlaps and disables scrolling

node.bodyText: @darshankawar I don't think scrolling while dropdown is active is intended behavior. No app scrolls while a dropdown is in active state as far as I have seen. It is however an issue if the dropdown is overlay-ed on a scrollview and it somehow blocks the scroll view from scrolling for some reason. In this case, op has a field embedded in scroll view

node.title: Failed assertion: line 4516 pos 12: '!_debugLocked': is not true.

node.bodyText: Closing as empty issue.

node.title: Webview cannot simulate clicking on ios，help me!!!!!

node.bodyText:
@ouyangzhanzhu
Can you provide complete code sample along with `flutter doctor -v along with actual vs expected behavior upon running the code ?
Not possible to simulate clicking on iOS, Apple does not provide any functionality to do that.

Not possible to simulate clicking on iOS, Apple does not provide any functionality to do that.

Hello, this is the case. I want to implement a click-simulation click function, that is, open a page in my app, and then simulate the click on the page I currently open. It is to click the button element of my app, which is equivalent to the performclick in Android. It is not cross-application click. Cross-application click is not allowed in iOS, but it should be allowed in my app, so I want to load the page in the app, Then it will automatically simulate clicking the like button on the web page, but Android can be implemented if it is currently implemented

There is no generic way to tap on an arbitrary element on iOS, even in your own app. But since this is in a WebView, you can do it in JavaScript using the WebViewController.
_controller.runJavascript('document.querySelector("#my-element").click()');
Hello, runJavascript can be used, but it can't click any button element on any website, and it can't do automatic adaptation

You can try this?
document.elementFromPoint(x, y).click();
But otherwise there is no way to help you. Flutter can not simulate a click into a platform widget such as webview on iOS.

thanks.
Closing the issue as solved with the above solution.

node.title: E/gralloc4( 9073): Empty SMPTE 2094-40 data

node.bodyText: Happening here too.

Hello @gkdgo. These logs are coming from the Android OS and not Flutter. You would be able to see these logs in the Android Studio logcat as well. From a quick Google search, it looks like it has something to do with the Vulkan Graphics API, but take that with a grain of salt as I am not an expert on Android :). Since this is not related to Flutter itself, I am closing this issue. Thank you

node.title: Lower `pub` verbosity in `flutter -v` mode

node.bodyText: @sigurdm if we use summary only mode for pub when running flutter verbosely, will we still see the relevant information if there's some kind of http error?

It makes sense to not run pub in verbose mode when it is run as a prestep of eg. flutter run. It is indeed very verbose, and not necessarily what you are interested in.

@sigurdm if we use summary only mode for pub when running flutter verbosely, will we still see the relevant information if there's some kind of http error?

In summary mode, if resolution fails (eg. because of a http error) you will get a line like:
Resolving dependencies failed. For details run `flutter pub get`

node.title: Problem with SystemChrome.setPreferredOrientations when I use it with an iPad with iOS 16

node.bodyText:
I have nearly issue on iOS with Flutter 3.7.3
Looks like flutter have not fixed on stable channel. #120875
• Flutter version 3.7.3 on channel stable at /Users/andy/Developer/flutter
• Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
• Framework revision 9944297138 (10 days ago), 2023-02-08 15:46:04 -0800
• Engine revision 248290d6d5
• Dart version 2.19.2
• DevTools version 2.20.1

Since this is an essential function, if indeed the problem has been solved in the 'master', I would recommend merging with the 'stable' version, otherwise the publication of apps will be blocked. Other bugs can be left but this one I would say no.
Hello @csacchetti. Is this issue reproducible on the master channel?

I am in a state of production at the moment and prefer to stay on the 'stable' version, so I have not been able to test whether it has been resolved in the master. I had previously been told that the problem had been addressed and solved in the master, so I was waiting for at least this fix to be merged into the 'stable' channel.

Based on #119473, looks like the fix is in master. You can request a cherry-pick into the stable channel. You can find more information here. But since this issue is fixed, I can closing this issue. Thank you
Can you give the "Commit Hash" and the "pr_link" of the master so I can put them in the Cherry-pick request. Thanks

I think I found them:
6ea01e6
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/stable/bin/internal/release-candidate-branch.version

node.title: NeverScrollableScrollPhysics doesn't work for Scrollable inside DraggableScrollableSheet in 3.7.3

node.bodyText:
Triage report
I can reproduce this issue with Master (3.8.0-14.0.pre.2) and Stable (3.7.3). I can also confirm that it doesn't scroll in 3.3.10

Code Sample (Same as OP)
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const App());
}

class App extends StatelessWidget {
  const App({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      home: Scaffold(
        body: Stack(
          children: [
            DraggableScrollableSheet(
              maxChildSize: 1,
              builder: (context, scrollController) => SingleChildScrollView(
                physics: const NeverScrollableScrollPhysics(),
                controller: scrollController,
                child: Column(
                  children: List.generate(
                    200,
                    (index) => Text(index.toString()),
                  ),
                ),
              ),
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

node.title: Is there any usage information for each version of Flutter SDK?

node.bodyText:
Hello @littleGnAl. Flutter has release notes for each non-patch versions, and breaking changes across these versions. You can also find information on hotfixes here.
Maintaining documentation for old versions of Flutter is currently not supported :) Though, I think your IDE is your best tool here with the linter telling you what works and what doesn't.
My recommendation is that you do upgrade to newer versions of Flutter. The SDK not being backwards compatible might be a good thing for your users if they have to upgrade their Flutter version to use it, as new Flutter versions provide not only great new features, but also fixes a lot of bugs, some of them quite critical.
I know it's not ideal, but unfortunately, there's nothing we can do currently :) Therefore, I will close this issue. Thank you

node.title: Failed assertion: line 702 pos 7: 'event is! RawKeyDownEvent || _keysPressed.isNotEmpty'

node.bodyText:
Hi @Li-00
When opening an issue, please try to provide all or some of the information indicated in the template so that we can address this issue properly.

Issue Template
If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
- https://flutter.dev/
- https://api.flutter.dev/
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
to what you're looking for, then fill our the template below. Please read
our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports

Steps to Reproduce

Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into.

Please attach a small application (ideally just one main.dart file) that
reproduces the problem. You could use https://gist.github.com/ for this.

If the problem is with your application's rendering, then please attach
a screenshot and explain what the problem is.

1. ...
2. ...
3. ...


Please tell us which target platform(s) the problem occurs (Android / iOS / Web / macOS / Linux / Windows)
Which target OS version, for Web, browser, is the test system running?
Does the problem occur on emulator/simulator as well as on physical devices?

Target Platform:
Target OS version/browser:
Devices:

Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
to explain how to solve the issue.

Run `flutter analyze` and attach any output of that command below.
If there are any analysis errors, try resolving them before filing this issue.

Finally, paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here.


Closing this issue, since no information has been provided. Once you provide information in the template, please write a comment and I will reopen this.
Thank you!

node.title: Switch between system keyboard and custom keyboard,there is jumping in the input box

node.bodyText: @jy6c9w08 This issue doesn't look like a proposal but an issue with the implementation in the code. Can you be more specific about what you tried to implement this?

@huycozy  Thanks for your reply.It is difficult for me to simplify the code of the second example.
You can see the source code of the second example herehttps://github.com/fluttercandies/extended_text_field/blob/master/example/lib/pages/complex/text_demo.dart
In the first GIF, I simply think that the emoji keyboard is hidden behind the system keyboard after the system keyboard pops up, and when the emoticon icon is clicked to switch the emoji keyboard, the system keyboard drops to reveal the emoji keyboard behind, and then click the keyboard icon, The system keyboard is overlaid on the expression bar again, and the whole process is smooth.(Telegram's chat page is a similar  example)
But in the second example, when switching from the emoji keyboard to the system keyboard, the input box first descends with the emoticon bar, and during this period the system keyboard pops up again to push the input box up, which causes a certain jumping phenomenon. (This may be  be solved by saving the height of the keyboard, but there are two keyboard heights for ios, one is the height of the system keyboard, and the other is the height of the emoji keyboard that comes with the system. If you need to detect and save these two heights, I think this is not an elegant approach)
Finaly,english is not my mother tongue,The description may not be very accurate, sorry.

node.title: `DropdownMenu.enableFilter` does not work

node.bodyText:
so you want a "normal dropdown ?"
this one -> https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/material/DropdownButton-class.html

DropdownMenu would be more suitable for desktop platforms because it uses the new overlay-based MenuAnchor instead of menu routes with hard-wired mobile-oriented transitions. I should open another issue for themeable popup and dropdown menu transitions, though.

Triage report
enableFilter does not seem to do anything regardless of the value. On mobile, it's always non-editable, and on desktop / web, it always is. Reproducible on Master (3.8.0-14.0.pre.2).

Code Sample
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MaterialApp(home: HomePage()));
}

class HomePage extends StatelessWidget {
  const HomePage({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      body: Center(
        child: DropdownMenu(
          enableFilter: false,
          enableSearch: false,
          initialSelection: 0,
          dropdownMenuEntries: [
            for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i)
              DropdownMenuEntry(
                value: i,
                label: 'entry $i',
              ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

node.title: [go_router] Url Path Strategy reloads the app when manually changing routes in the browser address bar

node.bodyText:
Hello @matheus-kirchesch-btor. Unfortunately this is a limitation of the browser. For the browser, you are accessing a new page and the browser triggers a full reload. With the hash strategy, in the view of the browser, you are on the same page so it doesn't trigger a reload, and the routing is then handled by go_router.
Since this is not an issue with Flutter or go_router itself, and is working as expected, I will close this issue. If you disagree, please comment with your reasoning and I can reopen the issue. Thank you

node.title: strange behavior with example "ShoppingList". Give me some HELP!

node.bodyText:
please check my code
if compare in main both has different hashCode --> first output
but when I print inside of ShoppingList it print same hashCode --> second output
void main() {
  print("hashCode in Main-------");
  print(Product(name: 'Eggs').hashCode);
  print(Product(name: 'Eggs').hashCode);
  print("-----------------------");

  runApp(const MaterialApp(
    title: 'Shopping App',
    home: ShoppingList(
      products: <Product>[
        Product(name: 'Eggs'),
        Product(name: 'Flour'),
        Product(name: 'Eggs'),
        Product(name: 'Meat'),
        Product(name: 'Chocolate chips'),
      ],
    ),
  ));
}
first output
flutter: hashCode in Main-------
flutter: 736582423
flutter: 267637177
flutter: -----------------------

second output
flutter: Eggs
flutter: 541143353
flutter: Flour
flutter: 735933277
flutter: Eggs
flutter: 541143353
flutter: Meat
flutter: 537526761
flutter: Chocolate chips
flutter: 325022717
Please past your code.

The MaterialApp uses const keyword, so the inner Product List is also const.
Since the Product class has only one field name, So the two products with same name in the const list are identical (same hashCode). The const list will reuse them.
You can modify Product by either adding unique index or overriding hashCode and == methods.

Hi @HoeYeon
This issue doesn't seem to describe a bug or a feature request. Please see https://flutter.dev/community for resources and asking questions like this,
you may also get some help if you post it on Stack Overflow and if you need help with your code, please see https://www.reddit.com/r/flutterhelp/
Closing, as this isn't an issue with Flutter itself. If you disagree, please write in the comments and I will reopen it.
Thank you

node.title: [camera] NPE in `CameraCaptureSession.close()`

node.bodyText:
Hi @emakar
Thanks for the report and also file a PR for this. But I see there's an open issue addressing the case you described #114012 which has the similar log and many users are reporting it too.
So I will close this issue in favor of #114012 which will help users be notified the progress. Please also update your PR description (link to #114012).

node.title: Questions about using webview_flutter: 4.0.4 plugin

node.bodyText: Hello @WFCN. You can pass the WebViewCookie directly into WebViewCookieManager.setCookie. See https://pub.dev/documentation/webview_flutter/latest/webview_flutter/WebViewCookieManager/setCookie.html. In fact, there isn't any method that has Strings as inputs. How are you setting the cookie in the first place?

node.title: SingleChildScrollView + Row not scroll

node.bodyText: Hello @AKA-LinCoder. This may be because there is enough space on the screen to display the items. Try resizing the window to make it smaller width-wise and try scrolling again. This is working as expected. Therefore, I'll close this issue. Thank you

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35401579/220134747-60c2cb8d-2557-47ff-a8


  
53-71422e295f32.mp4
Sorry, I've tried to reduce the screen size. i found  if i tap F12 make the chrome run in phone mode it can be scroll

Scrolling does not work with dragging on web and desktop. You can use the trackpad to scroll horizontally, or if you're using a mouse, you can press and hold shift and use the scroll wheel to scroll. This is working as intended
Thank you for your time,it worked , I found out that this was scrollable  on web before flutter 2.4，

but i found if  SingleChildScrollView with Column it worked ,SingleChildScrollView with row not work,In my opinion, if dragging is disabled, it should not work in both cases. Anyway  thank you so much!

node.title: Make `GoRouterState.path` and `GoRouterState.fullpath` non-nullable

node.bodyText:
Hello @momrak. Taking a quick look through the code, doesn't look like path has to be nullable. Though this is a very brief look and is non-conclusive to say the least. Here's a place where path is definitely not null. GoRoute.path is non-nullable so makes sense that path in GoRouterState can be non-nullable too. Same could apply for fullpath.
As I mentioned, my searching is non-conclusive so take this with a grain of salt. Labelling this issue for further insights from the team
https://github.com/flutter/packages/blob/a162a98cff4dd14bb4e21ed512b42558bb38d953/packages/go_router/lib/src/builder.dart#L260

node.title: break to run my appl
unbundling dependencies from engine (distro packaging)

node.bodyText:
packaging flutter for distributions (I'm a contributor to Alpine Linux, currently working on packaging flutter)

What's the use case here exactly? Unlike Chromium, the output of an engine build isn't a direct end-user product, and unlike a standard library isn't versioned for general-purpose use; an application built with the Flutter SDK has to be shipped with the exact corresponding version of the engine.
Is the goal here to ship a forked copy of the Flutter SDK itself that produces applications that use non-bundled, forked engine builds?
